pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:0.4: The sub-chapter on sunshades and sandals
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:0.5: 86. The training rule on ornamentations of the hip
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.2: At that time a nun was associating with the family of a certain woman.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.3: That woman said to that nun,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.4: “Venerable, please give this hip ornament to such-and-such a woman.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.6: “If I carry it in my bowl, I’ll get into trouble,” and so she put it on and then left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.7: While she was walking along a street the threads broke, and they were strewn all over.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.9: “How can nuns wear hip ornaments? They are just like householders who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.10: The nuns heard the complaints of those people.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.11: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.12: “How can a nun wear a hip ornament?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.13: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.16: “… How can a nun wear a hip ornament?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.17: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.18: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:1.19: ‘If a nun wears a hip ornament, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.1.8: if she wears it even once, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.2.2: if she wears it because of illness;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.2.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc86:2.2.6: The third training rule is finished.
